title: This Country Sales Citizenship For Greater Resilience Against Hurricanes
content: The Caribbean nation aims to become the world's most climate-resilient island without accruing massive debt or waiting for promised aid from wealthier nations.
summary: The Caribbean nation aims to become the world's most climate-resilient island without accruing massive debt or waiting for promised aid from wealthier nations.

title: "Suddenly You'd Hear Someone...": Israeli Hostage Recalls Hamas Captivity
content: According to reports, while 117 of the 251 hostages held in Gaza have so far been freed, 64 people are still in Hamas' captivity.
summary: According to reports, while 117 of the 251 hostages held in Gaza have so far been freed, 64 people are still in Hamas' captivity.

title: Russian "Spy Whale" Death: New Claim By Cops On How Hvaldimir Died
content: A beluga whale "Hvaldimir", found dead in Norway in August, was not shot to death as claimed by animal rights groups but died of bacterial infection, said Norwegian Police.
summary: A beluga whale "Hvaldimir", found dead in Norway in August, was not shot to death as claimed by animal rights groups but died of bacterial infection, said Norwegian Police.

title: "Collected Bodies For 3 Days": 600 Massacred Within Hours In This Country
content: About 600 people were killed within a few hours by members affiliated with Al-Qaeda in an August attack on the town of Barsalogho in Burkina Faso, reports claimed on Friday.
summary: About 600 people were killed within a few hours by members affiliated with Al-Qaeda in an August attack on the town of Barsalogho in Burkina Faso, reports claimed on Friday.

title: More Israeli Strikes Pound Beirut After Fresh Warning From Iran: 10 Points
content: Israeli airstrikes continued to pound Beirut on Saturday after Iran's supreme leader declared the country's allies won't back down in the war in West Asia that threatens severe global ramifications.
summary: Israeli airstrikes continued to pound Beirut on Saturday after Iran's supreme leader declared the country's allies won't back down in the war in West Asia that threatens severe global ramifications.

title: Elon Musk's X Pays $5.2 Million Brazil Fines But To Wrong Account
content: Elon Musk's X has paid millions of dollars in fines in Brazil to settle a row with a judge who banned the platform in its biggest Latin American market over disinformation.
summary: Elon Musk's X has paid millions of dollars in fines in Brazil to settle a row with a judge who banned the platform in its biggest Latin American market over disinformation.

title: "Hit Nuclear Sites First": Donald Trump's Big Warning To Iran
content: Republican White House hopeful Donald Trump said Friday he believes Israel should strike Iran's nuclear facilities in response to the Islamic republic's recent missile barrage.
summary: Republican White House hopeful Donald Trump said Friday he believes Israel should strike Iran's nuclear facilities in response to the Islamic republic's recent missile barrage.

title: Trump Promotes Fake Endorsement From JPMorgan CEO
content: Donald Trump on Friday promoted a fake endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon, who has not taken a side in the US presidential election.
summary: Donald Trump on Friday promoted a fake endorsement from JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon, who has not taken a side in the US presidential election.

title: US Says Its Forces Strike 15 Houthi Targets In Yemen
content: US forces on Friday hit 15 targets in Huthi-controlled areas of Yemen, the US military said.
summary: US forces on Friday hit 15 targets in Huthi-controlled areas of Yemen, the US military said.

title: Biden Says "I Don't Know" If Election Will Be Peaceful
content: President Joe Biden said Friday he wasn't confident the US election in November would be peaceful, due to previous comments by Republican contender Donald Trump.
summary: President Joe Biden said Friday he wasn't confident the US election in November would be peaceful, due to previous comments by Republican contender Donald Trump.

title: Israel Should Explore Alternatives To Attacking Iran Oil Sites, Says Biden
content: President Joe Biden on Friday urged Israel against striking Iran's oil facilities, a day after he said the United States was discussing the possibility of such strikes with its ally.
summary: President Joe Biden on Friday urged Israel against striking Iran's oil facilities, a day after he said the United States was discussing the possibility of such strikes with its ally.

title: Public Allowed To See Video Evidence In Mass Rape Trial In France
content: A court trying a French man charged with enlisting dozens of strangers to rape his heavily drugged wife ruled on Friday that the public could be present when video evidence is screened, reversing an earlier decision.
summary: A court trying a French man charged with enlisting dozens of strangers to rape his heavily drugged wife ruled on Friday that the public could be present when video evidence is screened, reversing an earlier decision.

title: Explained: What Happens Next In Israel-Iran Conflict
content: Israel's invasion of Lebanon this week and Iran's missile attack on its regional foe, all while war rages on in Gaza, have heightened the risk of a high-intensity conflict across the Middle East.
summary: Israel's invasion of Lebanon this week and Iran's missile attack on its regional foe, all while war rages on in Gaza, have heightened the risk of a high-intensity conflict across the Middle East.

title: Google Tests Verified Check Marks In Search Results For Certain Companies
content: Alphabet's Google is testing showing check marks next to certain companies on its search results, a company spokesperson said on Friday, in a move aimed at helping users identify verified sources and steer clear of fake websites.
summary: Alphabet's Google is testing showing check marks next to certain companies on its search results, a company spokesperson said on Friday, in a move aimed at helping users identify verified sources and steer clear of fake websites.

title: Drone Launched From "The East" Killed 2 Soldiers, Says Israel
content: The Israeli army on Friday said a drone launched "from the east" killed two soldiers, with a public broadcaster reporting the strike originated from Iraq and hit a base in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights.
summary: The Israeli army on Friday said a drone launched "from the east" killed two soldiers, with a public broadcaster reporting the strike originated from Iraq and hit a base in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights.

title: A Year After She Was Taken Hostage, Israeli Girl Adapts To New Family Life
content: Israeli couple Leron and Zoli Mor have identical tattoos on their arms showing a procession of eight elephants, their tails and trunks intertwined.
summary: Israeli couple Leron and Zoli Mor have identical tattoos on their arms showing a procession of eight elephants, their tails and trunks intertwined.

title: US Army Tests Robot Dogs Armed With AI-Enabled Guns: Report
content: The US Army is testing robot dogs mounted with AI-enabled guns at a military facility in the Middle East, according to Military.com.
summary: The US Army is testing robot dogs mounted with AI-enabled guns at a military facility in the Middle East, according to Military.com.

title: Over 2,000 "Military Sites" Hit During Ground Incursion In Lebanon: Israel
content: The Israeli army on Friday said its forces had hit more than 2,000 sites during its four-day incursion into southern Lebanon targeting Hezbollah positions.
summary: The Israeli army on Friday said its forces had hit more than 2,000 sites during its four-day incursion into southern Lebanon targeting Hezbollah positions.

title: India's EaseMyTrip Resumes Maldives Bookings After "Improved Ties"
content: Travel tech platform EaseMyTrip - which suspended flight bookings to Maldives in January after a diplomatic row with India - on Friday said it has resumed bookings to the island nation after "improved bilateral ties" between both governments.
summary: Travel tech platform EaseMyTrip - which suspended flight bookings to Maldives in January after a diplomatic row with India - on Friday said it has resumed bookings to the island nation after "improved bilateral ties" between both governments.

title: Spanish F-18 Fighter Jet Crashes While Flying Low, Pilot Dies
content: A Spanish Air Force pilot died when an F18 fighter plane crashed Friday in eastern Spain, officials said.
summary: A Spanish Air Force pilot died when an F18 fighter plane crashed Friday in eastern Spain, officials said.
